intro: Stephanocaryum olgae, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Its flowers are white and clustered in inflorescences, blooming in spring. Stephanocaryum olgae is often found in wetlands and pine flatwoods, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
